title: problem to update from 6.0.0 to 6.0.0a
body:
### expected behaviour
1) calling /_owncloud/index.php/apps/updater/update.php
2) click on update button and wait
3) should update correctly.

### actual behaviour
after clicking on update button, it says after about 30 seconds that the update failed (with no detail).


### steps to reproduce
1. going to admin page, then update center
2. launching the update
3. wait

### server configuration
operating system: debian 6.0.8

web server: apache/2.2.16 (debian)

database: mysql 5.1.72, for debian-linux-gnu (x86_64)

php version: php 5.3.3-7+squeeze18

owncloud version: 6.0.0 (fresh install)

updated from an older owncloud or fresh install: update from 6.0.0 fresh installed

list of activated app: default app and external storage only

the content of config/config.php: (without the database password and passwordsalt)
$config = array (
  'instanceid' => '123456',
  'passwordsalt' => '123456',
  'datadirectory' => '/home/owncloud_datas/',
  'dbtype' => 'mysql',
  'version' => '6.0.0.13',
  'dbname' => 'owncloud',
  'dbhost' => 'localhost',
  'dbtableprefix' => 'oc_',
  'dbuser' => 'owncloud',
  'dbpassword' => '123456',
  'installed' => true,
  'forcessl' => true,
);

are you using external storage, if yes which one:
yes, one local folder mounted for all users.

### client configuration
browser: chrome 31.0.1650.63

operating system: mac os 10.8.5

### logs
#### web server error log
nothing in apache logs

#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log)
{"app":"updater","message":"something went wrong for 3rdparty. rolling back.","level":3,"time":"2013-12-18t13:40:34+00:00"}
{"app":"updater","message":"unable to move \/var\/www\/default\/web\/_owncloud\/3rdparty\/archive to \/home\/owncloud_datas\/\/updater_backup\/tmp\/3rdparty\/archive","level":3,"time":"2013-12-18t13:40:34+00:00"}

#### browser log
nothing in chrome logs.

----------

i saw somewhere in forum or an other bug that open_basedir could be the problem (even if configured correctly).
i disabled it on this vhost, but it changed nothing. safe mode is always off.
